Speed limits in the United States are set by each state or territory. Highway speed 
limits can range from an urban low of 35 mph (56 km/h) to a rural high of 85 mph (
137 km/h). Speed limits are typically posted in increments of five miles per hour (
8 km/h). Some states have lower limits for trucks and at night, and occasionally 
there ... Texas, Utah, and Wyoming road networks have 80 mph (129 km/h) limits.
